description: From Middle English warte, werte, from Old English wearte, from Proto-West Germanic *wartā, from Proto-Germanic *wartǭ. Cognate with Dutch wrat, German Warze, Hunsrik Waarz, Swedish vårta.

entries.meaning: (pathology) A type of deformed growth occurring on the skin caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV).
examples: A wart has appeared on my toe.

entries.meaning: Any similar growth occurring in plants or animals, such as the parotoid glands in the back of toads.
(computing, programming, slang, derogatory) Any of the prefixes used in Hungarian notation.
examples: Hungarian warts suck big time! If you need them, your functions are too big and your class interface is much too fat.
